meanings.definition: The act or process of moving backward or in a reverse direction.
meanings.sent1: The retrogradations of the old car surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The retrogradations of the river caused it to flow in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent3: The retrogradations of the clock made time go in reverse!
meanings.sent4: His retrogradations in the game took him back to the starting point.
meanings.sent5: The retrogradations of the planets fascinated the astronomers.

meanings.definition: A decline or deterioration in quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The retrogradations of the painting were evident over time.
meanings.sent2: The retrogradations of the company's stock price worried investors.
meanings.sent3: The retrogradations of the cake's taste made it less appealing.
meanings.sent4: The retrogradations of the antique vase reduced its value significantly.
meanings.sent5: The retrogradations of the building's structure were concerning.

meanings.definition: A reversal or regression in progress or development.
meanings.sent1: The retrogradations in the project delayed its completion.
meanings.sent2: The retrogradations in his career were unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The retrogradations in the plant's growth puzzled the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The retrogradations in technology took us back to simpler times.
meanings.sent5: The retrogradations in the economy affected many businesses.
